Does Iran still have the means to retaliate against the US and Israel?
subhead: The salvos of missiles fired at Israel have become less frequent, a likely sign of Tehran's weakening position. Iran could still activate its allies, notably the Houthi movement, although the Houthis have so far upheld their ceasefire with Washington.
byline: By Ghazal Golshiri, Elise Vincent and Madjid Zerrouky

title: Refusing to become a manager is more common in France than elsewhere
subhead: According to an international survey by Cegos, a significant share of employees showed little interest in becoming managers, especially in France. The reasons include organizational culture, the image of the managerial role and the emergence of alternative models of professional success.

title: Paris Olympics and Paralympics cost taxpayers nearly €6 billion
subhead: The organization of the two sporting extravaganzas last summer cost €2.77 billion, which included €1.4 billion for security. A further €3.19 billion was spent on work linked to infrastructure projects.

title: Finding inspiration for photography in the kitchen
subhead: From Irving Penn's frozen fruits and vegetables to Sabine Weiss's fish trap and the Blumes' flying crockery, kitchens, their utensils, and their ingredients have long inspired photographers. Striking images by some 30 artists add spice to the exhibition 'Dans ma cuisine' ('In My Kitchen'), on view through July 31 at Les Douches gallery in Paris.

title: Trump's balancing act: Promising peace while striking Iran
subhead: Faced with opposition from some within his own party and Americans wary of another potential conflict, the US president insisted he acted 'to stop the war.' Yet he now faces the likelihood of having to deal with reprisals against US troops in the Middle East.

'A furnace': Life under Paris's zinc roofs during a heatwave
subhead: On Saturday, the French capital faced a heatwave, with temperatures reaching up to 36°C. The residents of the city's 'chambres de bonne,' small top-floor flats, struggled to cope.

title: From Peru to the Vatican, the rise of 'Monseñor Roberto de Chiclayo,' now Leo XIV
subhead: Francis's successor at the Vatican lived for many years in the South American country. Le Monde traveled to the city of Chiclayo to meet with several people who remember the days when he was still known as Robert Prevost.

title: The Heritage Foundation sets its sights on Europe
subhead: Since the beginning of his term, Donald Trump has been applying Project 2025, a 922-page bible written by the conservative think tank. Today, its president, Kevin Roberts, is looking across the Atlantic. On a visit to France, he met with leaders of far-right parties.
